title: Which Is More Terrifying: ‘Joker’ or ‘Downton Abbey’?
text:
Because the newly released “Joker” focuses on a troubled, self-infatuated loner given to sudden explosions of horrific violence, it has been compared with Martin Scorsese’s brilliant 1976 film “Taxi Driver.” This was the director’s intention. (If you can’t make a great film of your own, remake somebody else’s.) Comparisons to Scorsese’s 1982 “The King of Comedy” are equally valid, because both films revolve around sociopaths who seek careers as stand-up comics. And Robert DeNiro, who plays the pathetic losers in both “Taxi Driver” and “The King of Comedy,” even appears in “Joker.”

But...
description: Both movies feature weird hair, pasty makeup and the unusual anxieties of insecure people; the parallels are eerie.
